Employee: Phillip Spangenberg
Report Date: 2022-01-11
Doctor: Carla Marais
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are following up with a Urologist (2 yearly). You mentioned still experiencing a few symptoms at night - hopefully with some habit adjustments (avoid fluids before bedtime) & continuing Betmiga this will improve. You report a functional manageable baseline.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Your shoulder injury is preventing you from doing the sport you want to do. You are taking more NSAIDS than before and are tender on movement. You also have the palmer fasciitis of your hands. Referral to an Orthopaedic Surgeon that specialise in upper limbs are recommended.
Comment Key: ChronicMedicationList
Comment Value: Crestor , Trustan , Betmiga , Co Q10
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA 2.1
BMI and waist circumference raised

Employee: Phillip Spangenberg
Report Date: 2022-01-11
Doctor: Carla Marais
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Toe - need to xray and then consider referral to ortho. Looks like a ganglion from trauma. Shoulder needs review. Need to reduce waist circumference - weight training!
Men's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are following up with a Urologist (2 yearly). You mentioned still experiencing a few symptoms at night - hopefully with some habit adjustments (avoid fluids before bedtime) & continuing Betmiga this will improve. You report a functional manageable baseline.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Cholesterol: Reinitiate Crestor 5mg. Remember alcohol&diet play a significant role in your cardiovascular health. Take omega 3 supplements 2g daily. Repeat bloods after 3/12. Try to eliminate refined carbohydrates, exercise more frequently, increase fibre in your diet and lose some abdominal weight.
Comment Key: ChronicMedicationList
Comment Value: Crestor , Trustan , Betmiga , Co Q10
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA 2.1

Comment Value: Crestor , Trustan , Betmiga , Co Q10
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA 2.1
BMI and waist circumference raised
------------------------------

Try to eliminate refined carbohydrates, exercise more frequently, increase fibre in your diet and lose some abdominal weight.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA 2.1
BMI and waist circumference raised
------------------------------

Men's Health Recommendations: Try meds I've given you and let me know if all is good. Please see Urologist regularly for check ups.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Your eGFR is mildly decreased from your previous reading. This can be normal or an early marker of early disease. A repeat of your kidney function with a urine Protein:creatinine is recommended in 3/12

Overview Notes: Your shoulder injury is preventing you from doing the sport you want to do. You are taking more NSAIDS than before and are tender on movement. You also have the palmer fasciitis of your hands. Referral to an Orthopaedic Surgeon that specialise in upper limbs are recommended.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA 2.1
BMI and waist circumference raised

Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA 2.1

Overview Notes: Cholesterol: Reinitiate Crestor 5mg. Remember alcohol&diet play a significant role in your cardiovascular health. Take omega 3 supplements 2g daily. Repeat bloods after 3/12. Try to eliminate refined carbohydrates, exercise more frequently, increase fibre in your diet and lose some abdominal weight.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA 2.1
BMI and waist circumference raised

Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: There were no current concerns on your examination. Regular screening of any skin lesions is recommended - ‘Mole Mapping’ can be done with a Dermatologist. If any changes in size/ shape/ colour of a skin mark - to seek medical review.
Men's Health Recommendations: Try meds I've given you and let me know if all is good. Please see Urologist regularly for check ups.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Right ear polyps
Nodular Fasciitis, Right shoulder injury
Left palm pigmented mole
Mildly decreased eGFR 81
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA 2.1
BMI and waist circumference raised

Employee: Phillip Spangenberg
Report Date: 2022-01-11
Doctor: Carla Marais
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: There were no current concerns on your examination. Regular screening of any skin lesions is recommended - ‘Mole Mapping’ can be done with a Dermatologist. If any changes in size/ shape/ colour of a skin mark - to seek medical review.
Men's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are following up with a Urologist (2 yearly). You mentioned still experiencing a few symptoms at night - hopefully with some habit adjustments (avoid fluids before bedtime) & continuing Betmiga this will improve. You report a functional manageable baseline.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Your shoulder injury is preventing you from doing the sport you want to do. You are taking more NSAIDS than before and are tender on movement. You also have the palmer fasciitis of your hands. Referral to an Orthopaedic Surgeon that specialise in upper limbs are recommended.

You report a functional manageable baseline.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: The polyp in your right ear canal has increased in size, and have increased in number. Please have it reviewed by your ENT Specialist as it is now 1/3 of the ear canal.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA 2.1
BMI and waist circumference raised

You report a functional manageable baseline.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Cholesterol: Reinitiate Crestor 5mg. Remember alcohol&diet play a significant role in your cardiovascular health. Take omega 3 supplements 2g daily. Repeat bloods after 3/12. Try to eliminate refined carbohydrates, exercise more frequently, increase fibre in your diet and lose some abdominal weight.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA 2.1
BMI and waist circumference raised

Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Cholesterol: Reinitiate Crestor 5mg. Remember alcohol&diet play a significant role in your cardiovascular health. Take omega 3 supplements 2g daily. Repeat bloods after 3/12. Try to eliminate refined carbohydrates, exercise more frequently, increase fibre in your diet and lose some abdominal weight.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA 2.1
BMI and waist circumference raised

Men's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are following up with a Urologist (2 yearly). Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: There were no current concerns on your examination. Regular screening of any skin lesions is recommended - ‘Mole Mapping’ can be done with a Dermatologist. If any changes in size/ shape/ colour of a skin mark - to seek medical review.
Men's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are following up with a Urologist (2 yearly). You mentioned still experiencing a few symptoms at night - hopefully with some habit adjustments (avoid fluids before bedtime) & continuing Betmiga this will improve. You report a functional manageable baseline.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Increased waist circumference and age >50
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA 2.1
BMI and waist circumference raised
------------------------------

Men's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are following up with a Urologist (2 yearly). You mentioned still experiencing a few symptoms at night - hopefully with some habit adjustments (avoid fluids before bedtime) & continuing Betmiga this will improve. You report a functional manageable baseline.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Raised total cholesterol and LDL levels
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA 2.1
BMI and waist circumference raised

Report Date: 2022-01-11
Doctor: Carla Marais
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Toe - need to xray and then consider referral to ortho. Looks like a ganglion from trauma. Shoulder needs review. Need to reduce waist circumference - weight training!
Men's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are following up with a Urologist (2 yearly). You mentioned still experiencing a few symptoms at night - hopefully with some habit adjustments (avoid fluids before bedtime) & continuing Betmiga this will improve. You report a functional manageable baseline.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Your eGFR is mildly decreased from your previous reading. This can be normal or an early marker of early disease. A repeat of your kidney function with a urine Protein:creatinine is recommended in 3/12

Overview Notes: Your eGFR is mildly decreased from your previous reading. This can be normal or an early marker of early disease. A repeat of your kidney function with a urine Protein:creatinine is recommended in 3/12
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA 2.1

Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: There were no current concerns on your examination. Regular screening of any skin lesions is recommended - ‘Mole Mapping’ can be done with a Dermatologist. If any changes in size/ shape/ colour of a skin mark - to seek medical review.
Men's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are following up with a Urologist (2 yearly). You mentioned still experiencing a few symptoms at night - hopefully with some habit adjustments (avoid fluids before bedtime) & continuing Betmiga this will improve. Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA 2.1
BMI and waist circumference raised

Overview Notes: On your left palm you have an irregular mole that is increasing in size - please get it reviewed by a Dermatologist.

Employee: Phillip Spangenberg
Report Date: 2022-01-11
Doctor: Carla Marais
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: There were no current concerns on your examination. Regular screening of any skin lesions is recommended - ‘Mole Mapping’ can be done with a Dermatologist. If any changes in size/ shape/ colour of a skin mark - to seek medical review.
Men's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are following up with a Urologist (2 yearly). You mentioned still experiencing a few symptoms at night - hopefully with some habit adjustments (avoid fluids before bedtime) & continuing Betmiga this will improve. You report a functional manageable baseline.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: On your left palm you have an irregular mole that is increasing in size - please get it reviewed by a Dermatologist.

Men's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are following up with a Urologist (2 yearly). You mentioned still experiencing a few symptoms at night - hopefully with some habit adjustments (avoid fluids before bedtime) & continuing Betmiga this will improve. You report a functional manageable baseline.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Right ear polyps
Nodular Fasciitis, Right shoulder injury
Left palm pigmented mole
Mildly decreased eGFR 81
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA 2.1
BMI and waist circumference raised
------------------------------
Employee: Phillip Spangenberg
Report Date: 2022-01-11
Doctor: Carla Marais
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: There were no current concerns on your examination. Regular screening of any skin lesions is recommended - ‘Mole Mapping’ can be done with a Dermatologist. If any changes in size/ shape/ colour of a skin mark - to seek medical review.

Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Toe - need to xray and then consider referral to ortho. Looks like a ganglion from trauma. Shoulder needs review. Need to reduce waist circumference - weight training!

You mentioned still experiencing a few symptoms at night - hopefully with some habit adjustments (avoid fluids before bedtime) & continuing Betmiga this will improve. You report a functional manageable baseline.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Your shoulder injury is preventing you from doing the sport you want to do. You are taking more NSAIDS than before and are tender on movement. You also have the palmer fasciitis of your hands. Referral to an Orthopaedic Surgeon that specialise in upper limbs are recommended.

Men's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are following up with a Urologist (2 yearly). You mentioned still experiencing a few symptoms at night - hopefully with some habit adjustments (avoid fluids before bedtime) & continuing Betmiga this will improve. You report a functional manageable baseline.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Right ear polyps
Nodular Fasciitis, Right shoulder injury
Left palm pigmented mole
Mildly decreased eGFR 81
Comment Key: ClinicalExamComment
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA 2.1
BMI and waist circumference raised

Employee: Phillip Spangenberg
Report Date: 2022-01-11
Doctor: Carla Marais
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Toe - need to xray and then consider referral to ortho. Looks like a ganglion from trauma. Shoulder needs review. Need to reduce waist circumference - weight training!

You mentioned still experiencing a few symptoms at night - hopefully with some habit adjustments (avoid fluids before bedtime) & continuing Betmiga this will improve. You report a functional manageable baseline.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Your shoulder injury is preventing you from doing the sport you want to do. You are taking more NSAIDS than before and are tender on movement. You also have the palmer fasciitis of your hands. Referral to an Orthopaedic Surgeon that specialise in upper limbs are recommended.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamNote
Comment Value: Left palm - Irregular pigmented mole on left palm
Right ear - 3 x polyps
Pain in right shoulder on flexion and extension;Both palms - palmer fasciitis

Employee: Phillip Spangenberg
Report Date: 2022-01-11
Doctor: Carla Marais
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Toe - need to xray and then consider referral to ortho. Looks like a ganglion from trauma. Shoulder needs review. Need to reduce waist circumference - weight training!
Men's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are following up with a Urologist (2 yearly). You mentioned still experiencing a few symptoms at night - hopefully with some habit adjustments (avoid fluids before bedtime) & continuing Betmiga this will improve. You report a functional manageable baseline.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Cholesterol: Reinitiate Crestor 5mg. Remember alcohol&diet play a significant role in your cardiovascular health. Take omega 3 supplements 2g daily. Repeat bloods after 3/12. Try to eliminate refined carbohydrates, exercise more frequently, increase fibre in your diet and lose some abdominal weight.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamNote
Comment Value: Left palm - Irregular pigmented mole on left palm
Right ear - 3 x polyps
Pain in right shoulder on flexion and extension;Both palms - palmer fasciitis

Report Date: 2022-01-11
Doctor: Carla Marais
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are following up with a Urologist (2 yearly). You mentioned still experiencing a few symptoms at night - hopefully with some habit adjustments (avoid fluids before bedtime) & continuing Betmiga this will improve. You report a functional manageable baseline.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Right ear polyps
Nodular Fasciitis, Right shoulder injury
Left palm pigmented mole
Mildly decreased eGFR 81
Comment Key: ClinicalExamNote
Comment Value: Left palm - Irregular pigmented mole on left palm
Right ear - 3 x polyps
Pain in right shoulder on flexion and extension;Both palms - palmer fasciitis
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA 2.1
BMI and waist circumference raised
------------------------------
Employee: Phillip Spangenberg
Report Date: 2022-01-11
Doctor: Carla Marais
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are following up with a Urologist (2 yearly). You mentioned still experiencing a few symptoms at night - hopefully with some habit adjustments (avoid fluids before bedtime) & continuing Betmiga this will improve. You report a functional manageable baseline.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Your shoulder injury is preventing you from doing the sport you want to do. You are taking more NSAIDS than before and are tender on movement. You also have the palmer fasciitis of your hands. Referral to an Orthopaedic Surgeon that specialise in upper limbs are recommended.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamNote
Comment Value: Left palm - Irregular pigmented mole on left palm
Right ear - 3 x polyps
Pain in right shoulder on flexion and extension;Both palms - palmer fasciitis
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA 2.1
BMI and waist circumference raised

Employee: Phillip Spangenberg
Report Date: 2022-01-11
Doctor: Carla Marais
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: Try meds I've given you and let me know if all is good. Please see Urologist regularly for check ups.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Cholesterol: Reinitiate Crestor 5mg. Remember alcohol&diet play a significant role in your cardiovascular health. Take omega 3 supplements 2g daily. Repeat bloods after 3/12. Try to eliminate refined carbohydrates, exercise more frequently, increase fibre in your diet and lose some abdominal weight.
Comment Key: ClinicalExamNote
Comment Value: Left palm - Irregular pigmented mole on left palm
Right ear - 3 x polyps
Pain in right shoulder on flexion and extension;Both palms - palmer fasciitis

Comment Value: Left palm - Irregular pigmented mole on left palm
Right ear - 3 x polyps
Pain in right shoulder on flexion and extension;Both palms - palmer fasciitis
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA 2.1
BMI and waist circumference raised
------------------------------

Women's Health Recommendations:

Comment Key: ClinicalExamRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA 2.1
BMI and waist circumference raised
------------------------------
Employee: Phillip Spangenberg
Report Date: 2022-01-11
Doctor: Carla Marais
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: There were no current concerns on your examination. Regular screening of any skin lesions is recommended - ‘Mole Mapping’ can be done with a Dermatologist. If any changes in size/ shape/ colour of a skin mark - to seek medical review.
Men's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are following up with a Urologist (2 yearly). You mentioned still experiencing a few symptoms at night - hopefully with some habit adjustments (avoid fluids before bedtime) & continuing Betmiga this will improve. You report a functional manageable baseline.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Cholesterol: Reinitiate Crestor 5mg. Remember alcohol&diet play a significant role in your cardiovascular health. Take omega 3 supplements 2g daily. Repeat bloods after 3/12. Try to eliminate refined carbohydrates, exercise more frequently, increase fibre in your diet and lose some abdominal weight.

You report a functional manageable baseline.

Try to eliminate refined carbohydrates, exercise more frequently, increase fibre in your diet and lose some abdominal weight.

Overview Notes: Your shoulder injury is preventing you from doing the sport you want to do. You are taking more NSAIDS than before and are tender on movement. You also have the palmer fasciitis of your hands. Referral to an Orthopaedic Surgeon that specialise in upper limbs are recommended.
Comment Key: CurrentComplaintRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA 2.1
BMI and waist circumference raised
------------------------------
Employee: Phillip Spangenberg
Report Date: 2022-01-11
Doctor: Carla Marais
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: There were no current concerns on your examination. Regular screening of any skin lesions is recommended - ‘Mole Mapping’ can be done with a Dermatologist. If any changes in size/ shape/ colour of a skin mark - to seek medical review.
Men's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are following up with a Urologist (2 yearly). You mentioned still experiencing a few symptoms at night - hopefully with some habit adjustments (avoid fluids before bedtime) & continuing Betmiga this will improve. You report a functional manageable baseline.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Your eGFR is mildly decreased from your previous reading. This can be normal or an early marker of early disease. A repeat of your kidney function with a urine Protein:creatinine is recommended in 3/12
Comment Key: CurrentComplaintRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA 2.1
BMI and waist circumference raised

Employee: Phillip Spangenberg
Report Date: 2022-01-11
Doctor: Carla Marais
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are following up with a Urologist (2 yearly). You mentioned still experiencing a few symptoms at night - hopefully with some habit adjustments (avoid fluids before bedtime) & continuing Betmiga this will improve. You report a functional manageable baseline.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Cholesterol: Reinitiate Crestor 5mg. Remember alcohol&diet play a significant role in your cardiovascular health. Take omega 3 supplements 2g daily. Repeat bloods after 3/12. Try to eliminate refined carbohydrates, exercise more frequently, increase fibre in your diet and lose some abdominal weight.

Clinical Recommendations: Toe - need to xray and then consider referral to ortho. Looks like a ganglion from trauma. Shoulder needs review. Need to reduce waist circumference - weight training!
Men's Health Recommendations: Try meds I've given you and let me know if all is good. Please see Urologist regularly for check ups.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: On your left palm you have an irregular mole that is increasing in size - please get it reviewed by a Dermatologist.
Comment Key: CurrentComplaintRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA 2.1
BMI and waist circumference raised
------------------------------
Employee: Phillip Spangenberg
Report Date: 2022-01-11
Doctor: Carla Marais
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: There were no current concerns on your examination. Regular screening of any skin lesions is recommended - ‘Mole Mapping’ can be done with a Dermatologist. If any changes in size/ shape/ colour of a skin mark - to seek medical review.
Men's Health Recommendations: Try meds I've given you and let me know if all is good. Please see Urologist regularly for check ups.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Cholesterol: Reinitiate Crestor 5mg. Remember alcohol&diet play a significant role in your cardiovascular health. Take omega 3 supplements 2g daily. Repeat bloods after 3/12. Try to eliminate refined carbohydrates, exercise more frequently, increase fibre in your diet and lose some abdominal weight.
Comment Key: CurrentComplaintRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA 2.1
BMI and waist circumference raised

You report a functional manageable baseline.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: The polyp in your right ear canal has increased in size, and have increased in number. Please have it reviewed by your ENT Specialist as it is now 1/3 of the ear canal.
Comment Key: EyesightNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA 2.1
BMI and waist circumference raised
------------------------------
Employee: Phillip Spangenberg
Report Date: 2022-01-11
Doctor: Carla Marais
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: Try meds I've given you and let me know if all is good. Please see Urologist regularly for check ups.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Your shoulder injury is preventing you from doing the sport you want to do. You are taking more NSAIDS than before and are tender on movement. You also have the palmer fasciitis of your hands. Referral to an Orthopaedic Surgeon that specialise in upper limbs are recommended.
Comment Key: EyesightNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA 2.1
BMI and waist circumference raised
------------------------------
Employee: Phillip Spangenberg
Report Date: 2022-01-11
Doctor: Carla Marais
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: There were no current concerns on your examination. Regular screening of any skin lesions is recommended - ‘Mole Mapping’ can be done with a Dermatologist. If any changes in size/ shape/ colour of a skin mark - to seek medical review.
Men's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are following up with a Urologist (2 yearly). You mentioned still experiencing a few symptoms at night - hopefully with some habit adjustments (avoid fluids before bedtime) & continuing Betmiga this will improve. You report a functional manageable baseline.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Cholesterol: Reinitiate Crestor 5mg. Remember alcohol&diet play a significant role in your cardiovascular health. Take omega 3 supplements 2g daily. Repeat bloods after 3/12. Try to eliminate refined carbohydrates, exercise more frequently, increase fibre in your diet and lose some abdominal weight.
Comment Key: EyesightNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA 2.1
BMI and waist circumference raised

Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA 2.1
BMI and waist circumference raised
------------------------------
Employee: Phillip Spangenberg
Report Date: 2022-01-11
Doctor: Carla Marais
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Toe - need to xray and then consider referral to ortho. Looks like a ganglion from trauma. Shoulder needs review. Need to reduce waist circumference - weight training!
Men's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are following up with a Urologist (2 yearly). You mentioned still experiencing a few symptoms at night - hopefully with some habit adjustments (avoid fluids before bedtime) & continuing Betmiga this will improve. You report a functional manageable baseline.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Your eGFR is mildly decreased from your previous reading. This can be normal or an early marker of early disease. A repeat of your kidney function with a urine Protein:creatinine is recommended in 3/12
Comment Key: EyesightNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA 2.1

Employee: Phillip Spangenberg
Report Date: 2022-01-11
Doctor: Carla Marais
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Toe - need to xray and then consider referral to ortho. Looks like a ganglion from trauma. Shoulder needs review. Need to reduce waist circumference - weight training!

Try to eliminate refined carbohydrates, exercise more frequently, increase fibre in your diet and lose some abdominal weight.

Overview Notes: On your left palm you have an irregular mole that is increasing in size - please get it reviewed by a Dermatologist.
Comment Key: EyesightRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA 2.1
BMI and waist circumference raised
------------------------------
Employee: Phillip Spangenberg
Report Date: 2022-01-11
Doctor: Carla Marais
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Toe - need to xray and then consider referral to ortho. Looks like a ganglion from trauma. Shoulder needs review. Need to reduce waist circumference - weight training!
Men's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are following up with a Urologist (2 yearly). You mentioned still experiencing a few symptoms at night - hopefully with some habit adjustments (avoid fluids before bedtime) & continuing Betmiga this will improve. You report a functional manageable baseline.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Your shoulder injury is preventing you from doing the sport you want to do. You are taking more NSAIDS than before and are tender on movement. You also have the palmer fasciitis of your hands. Referral to an Orthopaedic Surgeon that specialise in upper limbs are recommended.
Comment Key: EyesightRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA 2.1
BMI and waist circumference raised

Doctor: Carla Marais
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Toe - need to xray and then consider referral to ortho. Looks like a ganglion from trauma. Shoulder needs review. Need to reduce waist circumference - weight training!
Men's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are following up with a Urologist (2 yearly). You mentioned still experiencing a few symptoms at night - hopefully with some habit adjustments (avoid fluids before bedtime) & continuing Betmiga this will improve. You report a functional manageable baseline.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Increased waist circumference and age >50
Comment Key: LabTestNote
Comment Value: eGFR 81 Uric acid slightly raised 0.43
Total Chol 7.2, LDL 5.4, Non-HDL 6.0
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA 2.1
BMI and waist circumference raised

Men's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are following up with a Urologist (2 yearly). You mentioned still experiencing a few symptoms at night - hopefully with some habit adjustments (avoid fluids before bedtime) & continuing Betmiga this will improve. Employee: Phillip Spangenberg
Report Date: 2022-01-11
Doctor: Carla Marais
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Toe - need to xray and then consider referral to ortho. Looks like a ganglion from trauma. Shoulder needs review. Need to reduce waist circumference - weight training!

Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Cholesterol: Reinitiate Crestor 5mg. Remember alcohol&diet play a significant role in your cardiovascular health. Take omega 3 supplements 2g daily. Repeat bloods after 3/12. Try to eliminate refined carbohydrates, exercise more frequently, increase fibre in your diet and lose some abdominal weight.

Men's Health Recommendations: Try meds I've given you and let me know if all is good. Please see Urologist regularly for check ups.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Raised total cholesterol and LDL levels
Comment Key: LabTestNote
Comment Value: eGFR 81 Uric acid slightly raised 0.43
Total Chol 7.2, LDL 5.4, Non-HDL 6.0
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA 2.1
BMI and waist circumference raised
------------------------------
Employee: Phillip Spangenberg
Report Date: 2022-01-11
Doctor: Carla Marais
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are following up with a Urologist (2 yearly). You mentioned still experiencing a few symptoms at night - hopefully with some habit adjustments (avoid fluids before bedtime) & continuing Betmiga this will improve. You report a functional manageable baseline.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Your shoulder injury is preventing you from doing the sport you want to do. You are taking more NSAIDS than before and are tender on movement. You also have the palmer fasciitis of your hands. Referral to an Orthopaedic Surgeon that specialise in upper limbs are recommended.
Comment Key: LabTestNote
Comment Value: eGFR 81 Uric acid slightly raised 0.43
Total Chol 7.2, LDL 5.4, Non-HDL 6.0

Clinical Recommendations: Toe - need to xray and then consider referral to ortho. Looks like a ganglion from trauma. Shoulder needs review. Need to reduce waist circumference - weight training!
Men's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are following up with a Urologist (2 yearly). You mentioned still experiencing a few symptoms at night - hopefully with some habit adjustments (avoid fluids before bedtime) & continuing Betmiga this will improve. You report a functional manageable baseline.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Raised total cholesterol and LDL levels
Comment Key: LabTestRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA 2.1
BMI and waist circumference raised
------------------------------
Employee: Phillip Spangenberg
Report Date: 2022-01-11
Doctor: Carla Marais
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: Try meds I've given you and let me know if all is good. Please see Urologist regularly for check ups.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Your eGFR is mildly decreased from your previous reading. This can be normal or an early marker of early disease. A repeat of your kidney function with a urine Protein:creatinine is recommended in 3/12

Employee: Phillip Spangenberg
Report Date: 2022-01-11
Doctor: Carla Marais
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: There were no current concerns on your examination. Regular screening of any skin lesions is recommended - ‘Mole Mapping’ can be done with a Dermatologist. If any changes in size/ shape/ colour of a skin mark - to seek medical review.
Men's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are following up with a Urologist (2 yearly). You mentioned still experiencing a few symptoms at night - hopefully with some habit adjustments (avoid fluids before bedtime) & continuing Betmiga this will improve. You report a functional manageable baseline.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Cholesterol: Reinitiate Crestor 5mg. Remember alcohol&diet play a significant role in your cardiovascular health. Take omega 3 supplements 2g daily. Repeat bloods after 3/12. Try to eliminate refined carbohydrates, exercise more frequently, increase fibre in your diet and lose some abdominal weight.
Comment Key: LabTestRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA 2.1
BMI and waist circumference raised

You report a functional manageable baseline.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: The polyp in your right ear canal has increased in size, and have increased in number. Please have it reviewed by your ENT Specialist as it is now 1/3 of the ear canal.
Comment Key: LabTestRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA 2.1
BMI and waist circumference raised
------------------------------

Report Date: 2022-01-11
Doctor: Carla Marais
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: There were no current concerns on your examination. Regular screening of any skin lesions is recommended - ‘Mole Mapping’ can be done with a Dermatologist. If any changes in size/ shape/ colour of a skin mark - to seek medical review.
Men's Health Recommendations: Try meds I've given you and let me know if all is good. Please see Urologist regularly for check ups.
Women's Health Recommendations:

You mentioned still experiencing a few symptoms at night - hopefully with some habit adjustments (avoid fluids before bedtime) & continuing Betmiga this will improve. You report a functional manageable baseline.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: The polyp in your right ear canal has increased in size, and have increased in number. Please have it reviewed by your ENT Specialist as it is now 1/3 of the ear canal.
Comment Key: LifestyleNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA 2.1
BMI and waist circumference raised
------------------------------

Employee: Phillip Spangenberg
Report Date: 2022-01-11
Doctor: Carla Marais
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: There were no current concerns on your examination. Regular screening of any skin lesions is recommended - ‘Mole Mapping’ can be done with a Dermatologist. If any changes in size/ shape/ colour of a skin mark - to seek medical review.
Men's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are following up with a Urologist (2 yearly). You mentioned still experiencing a few symptoms at night - hopefully with some habit adjustments (avoid fluids before bedtime) & continuing Betmiga this will improve. You report a functional manageable baseline.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Cholesterol: Reinitiate Crestor 5mg. Remember alcohol&diet play a significant role in your cardiovascular health. Take omega 3 supplements 2g daily. Repeat bloods after 3/12. Try to eliminate refined carbohydrates, exercise more frequently, increase fibre in your diet and lose some abdominal weight.
Comment Key: LifestyleNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA 2.1

------------------------------
Employee: Phillip Spangenberg
Report Date: 2022-01-11
Doctor: Carla Marais
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: There were no current concerns on your examination. Regular screening of any skin lesions is recommended - ‘Mole Mapping’ can be done with a Dermatologist. If any changes in size/ shape/ colour of a skin mark - to seek medical review.
Men's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are following up with a Urologist (2 yearly). You mentioned still experiencing a few symptoms at night - hopefully with some habit adjustments (avoid fluids before bedtime) & continuing Betmiga this will improve. You report a functional manageable baseline.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: On your left palm you have an irregular mole that is increasing in size - please get it reviewed by a Dermatologist.
Comment Key: LifestyleNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA 2.1
BMI and waist circumference raised
------------------------------
Employee: Phillip Spangenberg
Report Date: 2022-01-11
Doctor: Carla Marais
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: Try meds I've given you and let me know if all is good. Please see Urologist regularly for check ups.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Cholesterol: Reinitiate Crestor 5mg. Remember alcohol&diet play a significant role in your cardiovascular health. Take omega 3 supplements 2g daily. Repeat bloods after 3/12. Try to eliminate refined carbohydrates, exercise more frequently, increase fibre in your diet and lose some abdominal weight.
Comment Key: LifestyleNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA 2.1

BMI and waist circumference raised
------------------------------
Employee: Phillip Spangenberg
Report Date: 2022-01-11
Doctor: Carla Marais
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: There were no current concerns on your examination. Regular screening of any skin lesions is recommended - ‘Mole Mapping’ can be done with a Dermatologist. If any changes in size/ shape/ colour of a skin mark - to seek medical review.
Men's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are following up with a Urologist (2 yearly). You mentioned still experiencing a few symptoms at night - hopefully with some habit adjustments (avoid fluids before bedtime) & continuing Betmiga this will improve. You report a functional manageable baseline.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Increased waist circumference and age >50
Comment Key: LifestyleRecommendation

You mentioned still experiencing a few symptoms at night - hopefully with some habit adjustments (avoid fluids before bedtime) & continuing Betmiga this will improve. You report a functional manageable baseline.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Your shoulder injury is preventing you from doing the sport you want to do. You are taking more NSAIDS than before and are tender on movement. You also have the palmer fasciitis of your hands. Referral to an Orthopaedic Surgeon that specialise in upper limbs are recommended.
Comment Key: LifestyleRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA 2.1
BMI and waist circumference raised
------------------------------
Employee: Phillip Spangenberg
Report Date: 2022-01-11
Doctor: Carla Marais
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are following up with a Urologist (2 yearly). You mentioned still experiencing a few symptoms at night - hopefully with some habit adjustments (avoid fluids before bedtime) & continuing Betmiga this will improve. You report a functional manageable baseline.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Your eGFR is mildly decreased from your previous reading. This can be normal or an early marker of early disease. A repeat of your kidney function with a urine Protein:creatinine is recommended in 3/12

Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: There were no current concerns on your examination. Regular screening of any skin lesions is recommended - ‘Mole Mapping’ can be done with a Dermatologist. If any changes in size/ shape/ colour of a skin mark - to seek medical review.
Men's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are following up with a Urologist (2 yearly). You mentioned still experiencing a few symptoms at night - hopefully with some habit adjustments (avoid fluids before bedtime) & continuing Betmiga this will improve. You report a functional manageable baseline.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: The polyp in your right ear canal has increased in size, and have increased in number. Please have it reviewed by your ENT Specialist as it is now 1/3 of the ear canal.
Comment Key: MedicalHistoryNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA 2.1
BMI and waist circumference raised
------------------------------

Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Cholesterol: Reinitiate Crestor 5mg. Remember alcohol&diet play a significant role in your cardiovascular health. Take omega 3 supplements 2g daily. Repeat bloods after 3/12. Try to eliminate refined carbohydrates, exercise more frequently, increase fibre in your diet and lose some abdominal weight.

Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are following up with a Urologist (2 yearly). You mentioned still experiencing a few symptoms at night - hopefully with some habit adjustments (avoid fluids before bedtime) & continuing Betmiga this will improve. You report a functional manageable baseline.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Raised total cholesterol and LDL levels
Comment Key: MedicalHistoryRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA 2.1
BMI and waist circumference raised

Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: There were no current concerns on your examination. Regular screening of any skin lesions is recommended - ‘Mole Mapping’ can be done with a Dermatologist. If any changes in size/ shape/ colour of a skin mark - to seek medical review.
Men's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are following up with a Urologist (2 yearly). You mentioned still experiencing a few symptoms at night - hopefully with some habit adjustments (avoid fluids before bedtime) & continuing Betmiga this will improve. You report a functional manageable baseline.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Your shoulder injury is preventing you from doing the sport you want to do. You are taking more NSAIDS than before and are tender on movement. You also have the palmer fasciitis of your hands. Referral to an Orthopaedic Surgeon that specialise in upper limbs are recommended.
Comment Key: MedicalHistoryRecommendation
Comment Value: None

Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Your shoulder injury is preventing you from doing the sport you want to do. You are taking more NSAIDS than before and are tender on movement. You also have the palmer fasciitis of your hands. Referral to an Orthopaedic Surgeon that specialise in upper limbs are recommended.
Comment Key: MedicalHistoryRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA 2.1
BMI and waist circumference raised
------------------------------
Employee: Phillip Spangenberg
Report Date: 2022-01-11
Doctor: Carla Marais
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: There were no current concerns on your examination. Regular screening of any skin lesions is recommended - ‘Mole Mapping’ can be done with a Dermatologist. If any changes in size/ shape/ colour of a skin mark - to seek medical review.
Men's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are following up with a Urologist (2 yearly). You mentioned still experiencing a few symptoms at night - hopefully with some habit adjustments (avoid fluids before bedtime) & continuing Betmiga this will improve. You report a functional manageable baseline.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Cholesterol: Reinitiate Crestor 5mg. Remember alcohol&diet play a significant role in your cardiovascular health. Take omega 3 supplements 2g daily. Repeat bloods after 3/12. Try to eliminate refined carbohydrates, exercise more frequently, increase fibre in your diet and lose some abdominal weight.
Comment Key: MedicalHistoryRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA 2.1
BMI and waist circumference raised
------------------------------
Employee: Phillip Spangenberg
Report Date: 2022-01-11
Doctor: Carla Marais
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Toe - need to xray and then consider referral to ortho. Looks like a ganglion from trauma. Shoulder needs review. Need to reduce waist circumference - weight training!
Men's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are following up with a Urologist (2 yearly). You mentioned still experiencing a few symptoms at night - hopefully with some habit adjustments (avoid fluids before bedtime) & continuing Betmiga this will improve. You report a functional manageable baseline.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Your eGFR is mildly decreased from your previous reading. This can be normal or an early marker of early disease. A repeat of your kidney function with a urine Protein:creatinine is recommended in 3/12

Clinical Recommendations: Toe - need to xray and then consider referral to ortho. Looks like a ganglion from trauma. Shoulder needs review. Need to reduce waist circumference - weight training!
Men's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are following up with a Urologist (2 yearly). You mentioned still experiencing a few symptoms at night - hopefully with some habit adjustments (avoid fluids before bedtime) & continuing Betmiga this will improve. You report a functional manageable baseline.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: The polyp in your right ear canal has increased in size, and have increased in number. Please have it reviewed by your ENT Specialist as it is now 1/3 of the ear canal.
Comment Key: MensHealthNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA 2.1
BMI and waist circumference raised
------------------------------

Employee: Phillip Spangenberg
Report Date: 2022-01-11
Doctor: Carla Marais
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: There were no current concerns on your examination. Regular screening of any skin lesions is recommended - ‘Mole Mapping’ can be done with a Dermatologist. If any changes in size/ shape/ colour of a skin mark - to seek medical review.
Men's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are following up with a Urologist (2 yearly). You mentioned still experiencing a few symptoms at night - hopefully with some habit adjustments (avoid fluids before bedtime) & continuing Betmiga this will improve. You report a functional manageable baseline.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Cholesterol: Reinitiate Crestor 5mg. Remember alcohol&diet play a significant role in your cardiovascular health. Take omega 3 supplements 2g daily. Repeat bloods after 3/12. Try to eliminate refined carbohydrates, exercise more frequently, increase fibre in your diet and lose some abdominal weight.
Comment Key: MensHealthNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA 2.1

------------------------------
Employee: Phillip Spangenberg
Report Date: 2022-01-11
Doctor: Carla Marais
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Toe - need to xray and then consider referral to ortho. Looks like a ganglion from trauma. Shoulder needs review. Need to reduce waist circumference - weight training!
Men's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are following up with a Urologist (2 yearly). You mentioned still experiencing a few symptoms at night - hopefully with some habit adjustments (avoid fluids before bedtime) & continuing Betmiga this will improve. You report a functional manageable baseline.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Cholesterol: Reinitiate Crestor 5mg. Remember alcohol&diet play a significant role in your cardiovascular health. Take omega 3 supplements 2g daily. Repeat bloods after 3/12. Try to eliminate refined carbohydrates, exercise more frequently, increase fibre in your diet and lose some abdominal weight.
Comment Key: MensHealthNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA 2.1

Clinical Recommendations: Toe - need to xray and then consider referral to ortho. Looks like a ganglion from trauma. Shoulder needs review. Need to reduce waist circumference - weight training!
Men's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are following up with a Urologist (2 yearly). You mentioned still experiencing a few symptoms at night - hopefully with some habit adjustments (avoid fluids before bedtime) & continuing Betmiga this will improve. You report a functional manageable baseline.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Your eGFR is mildly decreased from your previous reading. This can be normal or an early marker of early disease. A repeat of your kidney function with a urine Protein:creatinine is recommended in 3/12
Comment Key: MensHealthRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA 2.1
BMI and waist circumference raised
------------------------------

Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are following up with a Urologist (2 yearly). Try to eliminate refined carbohydrates, exercise more frequently, increase fibre in your diet and lose some abdominal weight.

Men's Health Recommendations: Try meds I've given you and let me know if all is good. Please see Urologist regularly for check ups.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Your shoulder injury is preventing you from doing the sport you want to do. You are taking more NSAIDS than before and are tender on movement. You also have the palmer fasciitis of your hands. Referral to an Orthopaedic Surgeon that specialise in upper limbs are recommended.
Comment Key: MensHealthRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA 2.1
BMI and waist circumference raised
------------------------------

Overview Notes: Your shoulder injury is preventing you from doing the sport you want to do. You are taking more NSAIDS than before and are tender on movement. You also have the palmer fasciitis of your hands. Referral to an Orthopaedic Surgeon that specialise in upper limbs are recommended.
Comment Key: MentalHealthAnxietyRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA 2.1
BMI and waist circumference raised
------------------------------
Employee: Phillip Spangenberg
Report Date: 2022-01-11
Doctor: Carla Marais
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Toe - need to xray and then consider referral to ortho. Looks like a ganglion from trauma. Shoulder needs review. Need to reduce waist circumference - weight training!
Men's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are following up with a Urologist (2 yearly). You mentioned still experiencing a few symptoms at night - hopefully with some habit adjustments (avoid fluids before bedtime) & continuing Betmiga this will improve. You report a functional manageable baseline.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: The polyp in your right ear canal has increased in size, and have increased in number. Please have it reviewed by your ENT Specialist as it is now 1/3 of the ear canal.
Comment Key: MentalHealthAnxietyRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA 2.1

Men's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are following up with a Urologist (2 yearly). Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Your eGFR is mildly decreased from your previous reading. This can be normal or an early marker of early disease. A repeat of your kidney function with a urine Protein:creatinine is recommended in 3/12

------------------------------
Employee: Phillip Spangenberg
Report Date: 2022-01-11
Doctor: Carla Marais
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: Try meds I've given you and let me know if all is good. Please see Urologist regularly for check ups.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Your shoulder injury is preventing you from doing the sport you want to do. You are taking more NSAIDS than before and are tender on movement. You also have the palmer fasciitis of your hands. Referral to an Orthopaedic Surgeon that specialise in upper limbs are recommended.

Employee: Phillip Spangenberg
Report Date: 2022-01-11
Doctor: Carla Marais
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are following up with a Urologist (2 yearly). You mentioned still experiencing a few symptoms at night - hopefully with some habit adjustments (avoid fluids before bedtime) & continuing Betmiga this will improve. You report a functional manageable baseline.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Cholesterol: Reinitiate Crestor 5mg. Remember alcohol&diet play a significant role in your cardiovascular health. Take omega 3 supplements 2g daily. Repeat bloods after 3/12. Try to eliminate refined carbohydrates, exercise more frequently, increase fibre in your diet and lose some abdominal weight.

Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: There were no current concerns on your examination. Regular screening of any skin lesions is recommended - ‘Mole Mapping’ can be done with a Dermatologist. If any changes in size/ shape/ colour of a skin mark - to seek medical review.
Men's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are following up with a Urologist (2 yearly). You mentioned still experiencing a few symptoms at night - hopefully with some habit adjustments (avoid fluids before bedtime) & continuing Betmiga this will improve. You report a functional manageable baseline.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Your shoulder injury is preventing you from doing the sport you want to do. You are taking more NSAIDS than before and are tender on movement. You also have the palmer fasciitis of your hands. Referral to an Orthopaedic Surgeon that specialise in upper limbs are recommended.
Comment Key: MentalHealthMoodRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA 2.1
BMI and waist circumference raised
------------------------------
Employee: Phillip Spangenberg
Report Date: 2022-01-11
Doctor: Carla Marais
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: Try meds I've given you and let me know if all is good. Please see Urologist regularly for check ups.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Your eGFR is mildly decreased from your previous reading. This can be normal or an early marker of early disease. A repeat of your kidney function with a urine Protein:creatinine is recommended in 3/12

Try to eliminate refined carbohydrates, exercise more frequently, increase fibre in your diet and lose some abdominal weight.
Comment Key: MentalHealthNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA 2.1
BMI and waist circumference raised
------------------------------

Men's Health Recommendations: Try meds I've given you and let me know if all is good. Please see Urologist regularly for check ups.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Your eGFR is mildly decreased from your previous reading. This can be normal or an early marker of early disease. A repeat of your kidney function with a urine Protein:creatinine is recommended in 3/12
Comment Key: MentalHealthNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA 2.1
BMI and waist circumference raised
------------------------------
Employee: Phillip Spangenberg
Report Date: 2022-01-11
Doctor: Carla Marais
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations:

You mentioned still experiencing a few symptoms at night - hopefully with some habit adjustments (avoid fluids before bedtime) & continuing Betmiga this will improve. You report a functional manageable baseline.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: The polyp in your right ear canal has increased in size, and have increased in number. Please have it reviewed by your ENT Specialist as it is now 1/3 of the ear canal.

Employee: Phillip Spangenberg
Report Date: 2022-01-11
Doctor: Carla Marais
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Toe - need to xray and then consider referral to ortho. Looks like a ganglion from trauma. Shoulder needs review. Need to reduce waist circumference - weight training!

You mentioned still experiencing a few symptoms at night - hopefully with some habit adjustments (avoid fluids before bedtime) & continuing Betmiga this will improve. You report a functional manageable baseline.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Your shoulder injury is preventing you from doing the sport you want to do. You are taking more NSAIDS than before and are tender on movement. You also have the palmer fasciitis of your hands. Referral to an Orthopaedic Surgeon that specialise in upper limbs are recommended.

------------------------------
Employee: Phillip Spangenberg
Report Date: 2022-01-11
Doctor: Carla Marais
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: There were no current concerns on your examination. Regular screening of any skin lesions is recommended - ‘Mole Mapping’ can be done with a Dermatologist. If any changes in size/ shape/ colour of a skin mark - to seek medical review.
Men's Health Recommendations: Try meds I've given you and let me know if all is good. Please see Urologist regularly for check ups.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Raised total cholesterol and LDL levels

Special Investigation Notes: DHEA 2.1
BMI and waist circumference raised
------------------------------
Employee: Phillip Spangenberg
Report Date: 2022-01-11
Doctor: Carla Marais
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are following up with a Urologist (2 yearly). You mentioned still experiencing a few symptoms at night - hopefully with some habit adjustments (avoid fluids before bedtime) & continuing Betmiga this will improve. You report a functional manageable baseline.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Cholesterol: Reinitiate Crestor 5mg. Remember alcohol&diet play a significant role in your cardiovascular health. Take omega 3 supplements 2g daily. Repeat bloods after 3/12. Try to eliminate refined carbohydrates, exercise more frequently, increase fibre in your diet and lose some abdominal weight.
Comment Key: MentalHealthStressRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA 2.1

You report a functional manageable baseline.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Your eGFR is mildly decreased from your previous reading. This can be normal or an early marker of early disease. A repeat of your kidney function with a urine Protein:creatinine is recommended in 3/12

Nurse: Lebo Cindi

You report a functional manageable baseline.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Your shoulder injury is preventing you from doing the sport you want to do. You are taking more NSAIDS than before and are tender on movement. You also have the palmer fasciitis of your hands. Referral to an Orthopaedic Surgeon that specialise in upper limbs are recommended.

Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Cholesterol: Reinitiate Crestor 5mg. Remember alcohol&diet play a significant role in your cardiovascular health. Take omega 3 supplements 2g daily. Repeat bloods after 3/12. Try to eliminate refined carbohydrates, exercise more frequently, increase fibre in your diet and lose some abdominal weight.
Comment Key: ReportNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA 2.1
BMI and waist circumference raised
------------------------------

Nurse: Lebo Cindi

Men's Health Recommendations: Try meds I've given you and let me know if all is good. Please see Urologist regularly for check ups.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Your eGFR is mildly decreased from your previous reading. This can be normal or an early marker of early disease. A repeat of your kidney function with a urine Protein:creatinine is recommended in 3/12

Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: The polyp in your right ear canal has increased in size, and have increased in number. Please have it reviewed by your ENT Specialist as it is now 1/3 of the ear canal.
Comment Key: ReportRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA 2.1
BMI and waist circumference raised
------------------------------
Employee: Phillip Spangenberg
Report Date: 2022-01-11
Doctor: Carla Marais
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Toe - need to xray and then consider referral to ortho. Looks like a ganglion from trauma. Shoulder needs review. Need to reduce waist circumference - weight training!
Men's Health Recommendations: Try meds I've given you and let me know if all is good. Please see Urologist regularly for check ups.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Your shoulder injury is preventing you from doing the sport you want to do. You are taking more NSAIDS than before and are tender on movement. You also have the palmer fasciitis of your hands. Referral to an Orthopaedic Surgeon that specialise in upper limbs are recommended.
Comment Key: ReportRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA 2.1
BMI and waist circumference raised
------------------------------
Employee: Phillip Spangenberg
Report Date: 2022-01-11
Doctor: Carla Marais
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: There were no current concerns on your examination. Regular screening of any skin lesions is recommended - ‘Mole Mapping’ can be done with a Dermatologist. If any changes in size/ shape/ colour of a skin mark - to seek medical review.
Men's Health Recommendations: Try meds I've given you and let me know if all is good. Please see Urologist regularly for check ups.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Your eGFR is mildly decreased from your previous reading. This can be normal or an early marker of early disease. A repeat of your kidney function with a urine Protein:creatinine is recommended in 3/12

Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: Try meds I've given you and let me know if all is good. Please see Urologist regularly for check ups.

Overview Notes: Right ear polyps

Left palm pigmented mole
Mildly decreased eGFR 81

You report a functional manageable baseline.

Overview Notes: On your left palm you have an irregular mole that is increasing in size - please get it reviewed by a Dermatologist.

Doctor: Carla Marais
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are following up with a Urologist (2 yearly). You mentioned still experiencing a few symptoms at night - hopefully with some habit adjustments (avoid fluids before bedtime) & continuing Betmiga this will improve. You report a functional manageable baseline.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Your shoulder injury is preventing you from doing the sport you want to do. You are taking more NSAIDS than before and are tender on movement. You also have the palmer fasciitis of your hands. Referral to an Orthopaedic Surgeon that specialise in upper limbs are recommended.
Comment Key: SpecialInvestigationNote
Comment Value: DHEA 2.1
BMI and waist circumference raised
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA 2.1
BMI and waist circumference raised

Doctor: Carla Marais
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Toe - need to xray and then consider referral to ortho. Looks like a ganglion from trauma. Shoulder needs review. Need to reduce waist circumference - weight training!
Men's Health Recommendations: Try meds I've given you and let me know if all is good. Please see Urologist regularly for check ups.

Overview Notes: No alcohol use
No smoking

Employee: Phillip Spangenberg
Report Date: 2022-01-11
Doctor: Carla Marais
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: Try meds I've given you and let me know if all is good. Please see Urologist regularly for check ups.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Cholesterol: Reinitiate Crestor 5mg. Remember alcohol&diet play a significant role in your cardiovascular health. Take omega 3 supplements 2g daily. Repeat bloods after 3/12. Try to eliminate refined carbohydrates, exercise more frequently, increase fibre in your diet and lose some abdominal weight.

Report Date: 2022-01-11
Doctor: Carla Marais
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Toe - need to xray and then consider referral to ortho. Looks like a ganglion from trauma. Shoulder needs review. Need to reduce waist circumference - weight training!
Men's Health Recommendations: Try meds I've given you and let me know if all is good. Please see Urologist regularly for check ups.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Increased waist circumference and age >50
Comment Key: SpecialInvestigationRecommendation

Employee: Phillip Spangenberg
Report Date: 2022-01-11
Doctor: Carla Marais
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: There were no current concerns on your examination. Regular screening of any skin lesions is recommended - ‘Mole Mapping’ can be done with a Dermatologist. If any changes in size/ shape/ colour of a skin mark - to seek medical review.
Men's Health Recommendations: Try meds I've given you and let me know if all is good. Please see Urologist regularly for check ups.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Your eGFR is mildly decreased from your previous reading. This can be normal or an early marker of early disease. A repeat of your kidney function with a urine Protein:creatinine is recommended in 3/12
Comment Key: SpecialInvestigationRecommendation
Comment Value: None

Employee: Phillip Spangenberg
Report Date: 2022-01-11
Doctor: Carla Marais
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: There were no current concerns on your examination. Regular screening of any skin lesions is recommended - ‘Mole Mapping’ can be done with a Dermatologist. If any changes in size/ shape/ colour of a skin mark - to seek medical review.
Men's Health Recommendations: Try meds I've given you and let me know if all is good. Please see Urologist regularly for check ups.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Cholesterol: Reinitiate Crestor 5mg. Remember alcohol&diet play a significant role in your cardiovascular health. Take omega 3 supplements 2g daily. Repeat bloods after 3/12. Try to eliminate refined carbohydrates, exercise more frequently, increase fibre in your diet and lose some abdominal weight.

Employee: Phillip Spangenberg
Report Date: 2022-01-11
Doctor: Carla Marais
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Toe - need to xray and then consider referral to ortho. Looks like a ganglion from trauma. Shoulder needs review. Need to reduce waist circumference - weight training!

You report a functional manageable baseline.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Your shoulder injury is preventing you from doing the sport you want to do. You are taking more NSAIDS than before and are tender on movement. You also have the palmer fasciitis of your hands. Referral to an Orthopaedic Surgeon that specialise in upper limbs are recommended.

Employee: Phillip Spangenberg
Report Date: 2022-01-11
Doctor: Carla Marais
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: There were no current concerns on your examination. Regular screening of any skin lesions is recommended - ‘Mole Mapping’ can be done with a Dermatologist. If any changes in size/ shape/ colour of a skin mark - to seek medical review.
Men's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are following up with a Urologist (2 yearly). You mentioned still experiencing a few symptoms at night - hopefully with some habit adjustments (avoid fluids before bedtime) & continuing Betmiga this will improve. You report a functional manageable baseline.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: The polyp in your right ear canal has increased in size, and have increased in number. Please have it reviewed by your ENT Specialist as it is now 1/3 of the ear canal.

Employee: Phillip Spangenberg
Report Date: 2022-01-11
Doctor: Carla Marais
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Toe - need to xray and then consider referral to ortho. Looks like a ganglion from trauma. Shoulder needs review. Need to reduce waist circumference - weight training!
Men's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are following up with a Urologist (2 yearly). You mentioned still experiencing a few symptoms at night - hopefully with some habit adjustments (avoid fluids before bedtime) & continuing Betmiga this will improve. You report a functional manageable baseline.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Cholesterol: Reinitiate Crestor 5mg. Remember alcohol&diet play a significant role in your cardiovascular health. Take omega 3 supplements 2g daily. Repeat bloods after 3/12. Try to eliminate refined carbohydrates, exercise more frequently, increase fibre in your diet and lose some abdominal weight.
Comment Key: SpecialInvestigationRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA 2.1
BMI and waist circumference raised

Special Investigation Notes: DHEA 2.1
BMI and waist circumference raised
------------------------------
Employee: Phillip Spangenberg
Report Date: 2022-01-11
Doctor: Carla Marais
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Toe - need to xray and then consider referral to ortho. Looks like a ganglion from trauma. Shoulder needs review. Need to reduce waist circumference - weight training!
Men's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are following up with a Urologist (2 yearly). You mentioned still experiencing a few symptoms at night - hopefully with some habit adjustments (avoid fluids before bedtime) & continuing Betmiga this will improve. You report a functional manageable baseline.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Your eGFR is mildly decreased from your previous reading. This can be normal or an early marker of early disease. A repeat of your kidney function with a urine Protein:creatinine is recommended in 3/12
Comment Key: SymptomScreeningNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA 2.1

Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Your shoulder injury is preventing you from doing the sport you want to do. You are taking more NSAIDS than before and are tender on movement. You also have the palmer fasciitis of your hands. Referral to an Orthopaedic Surgeon that specialise in upper limbs are recommended.
Comment Key: SymptomScreeningNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA 2.1
BMI and waist circumference raised
------------------------------
Employee: Phillip Spangenberg
Report Date: 2022-01-11
Doctor: Carla Marais
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are following up with a Urologist (2 yearly). You mentioned still experiencing a few symptoms at night - hopefully with some habit adjustments (avoid fluids before bedtime) & continuing Betmiga this will improve. You report a functional manageable baseline.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Cholesterol: Reinitiate Crestor 5mg. Remember alcohol&diet play a significant role in your cardiovascular health. Take omega 3 supplements 2g daily. Repeat bloods after 3/12. Try to eliminate refined carbohydrates, exercise more frequently, increase fibre in your diet and lose some abdominal weight.
Comment Key: SymptomScreeningNote
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA 2.1
BMI and waist circumference raised

Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Your eGFR is mildly decreased from your previous reading. This can be normal or an early marker of early disease. A repeat of your kidney function with a urine Protein:creatinine is recommended in 3/12

Comment Key: SymptomScreeningRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA 2.1
BMI and waist circumference raised
------------------------------

Employee: Phillip Spangenberg
Report Date: 2022-01-11
Doctor: Carla Marais
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Toe - need to xray and then consider referral to ortho. Looks like a ganglion from trauma. Shoulder needs review. Need to reduce waist circumference - weight training!

You report a functional manageable baseline.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Cholesterol: Reinitiate Crestor 5mg. Remember alcohol&diet play a significant role in your cardiovascular health. Take omega 3 supplements 2g daily. Repeat bloods after 3/12. Try to eliminate refined carbohydrates, exercise more frequently, increase fibre in your diet and lose some abdominal weight.

Comment Value: None

Clinical Recommendations: There were no current concerns on your examination. Regular screening of any skin lesions is recommended - ‘Mole Mapping’ can be done with a Dermatologist. If any changes in size/ shape/ colour of a skin mark - to seek medical review.
Men's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are following up with a Urologist (2 yearly). You mentioned still experiencing a few symptoms at night - hopefully with some habit adjustments (avoid fluids before bedtime) & continuing Betmiga this will improve. You report a functional manageable baseline.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: No alcohol use
No smoking
Comment Key: VitalsNote
Comment Value: Waist to height ratio >50%
BMI raised
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA 2.1
BMI and waist circumference raised
------------------------------

Nurse: Lebo Cindi

Employee: Phillip Spangenberg
Report Date: 2022-01-11
Doctor: Carla Marais
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: There were no current concerns on your examination. Regular screening of any skin lesions is recommended - ‘Mole Mapping’ can be done with a Dermatologist. If any changes in size/ shape/ colour of a skin mark - to seek medical review.
Men's Health Recommendations: Try meds I've given you and let me know if all is good. Please see Urologist regularly for check ups.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Your shoulder injury is preventing you from doing the sport you want to do. You are taking more NSAIDS than before and are tender on movement. You also have the palmer fasciitis of your hands. Referral to an Orthopaedic Surgeon that specialise in upper limbs are recommended.
Comment Key: VitalsNote
Comment Value: Waist to height ratio >50%
BMI raised

Employee: Phillip Spangenberg

Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations:

Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Cholesterol: Reinitiate Crestor 5mg. Remember alcohol&diet play a significant role in your cardiovascular health. Take omega 3 supplements 2g daily. Repeat bloods after 3/12. Try to eliminate refined carbohydrates, exercise more frequently, increase fibre in your diet and lose some abdominal weight.

Clinical Recommendations: Toe - need to xray and then consider referral to ortho. Looks like a ganglion from trauma. Shoulder needs review. Need to reduce waist circumference - weight training!

You report a functional manageable baseline.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Your eGFR is mildly decreased from your previous reading. This can be normal or an early marker of early disease. A repeat of your kidney function with a urine Protein:creatinine is recommended in 3/12

Employee: Phillip Spangenberg
Report Date: 2022-01-11
Doctor: Carla Marais
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: Toe - need to xray and then consider referral to ortho. Looks like a ganglion from trauma. Shoulder needs review. Need to reduce waist circumference - weight training!
Men's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are following up with a Urologist (2 yearly). You mentioned still experiencing a few symptoms at night - hopefully with some habit adjustments (avoid fluids before bedtime) & continuing Betmiga this will improve. You report a functional manageable baseline.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Cholesterol: Reinitiate Crestor 5mg. Remember alcohol&diet play a significant role in your cardiovascular health. Take omega 3 supplements 2g daily. Repeat bloods after 3/12. Try to eliminate refined carbohydrates, exercise more frequently, increase fibre in your diet and lose some abdominal weight.
Comment Key: VitalsRecommendation
Comment Value: None

Men's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are following up with a Urologist (2 yearly). You mentioned still experiencing a few symptoms at night - hopefully with some habit adjustments (avoid fluids before bedtime) & continuing Betmiga this will improve. You report a functional manageable baseline.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Your shoulder injury is preventing you from doing the sport you want to do. You are taking more NSAIDS than before and are tender on movement. You also have the palmer fasciitis of your hands. Referral to an Orthopaedic Surgeon that specialise in upper limbs are recommended.
Comment Key: VitalsRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA 2.1
BMI and waist circumference raised
------------------------------
Employee: Phillip Spangenberg
Report Date: 2022-01-11
Doctor: Carla Marais
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: There were no current concerns on your examination. Regular screening of any skin lesions is recommended - ‘Mole Mapping’ can be done with a Dermatologist. If any changes in size/ shape/ colour of a skin mark - to seek medical review.
Men's Health Recommendations: Try meds I've given you and let me know if all is good. Please see Urologist regularly for check ups.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Cholesterol: Reinitiate Crestor 5mg. Remember alcohol&diet play a significant role in your cardiovascular health. Take omega 3 supplements 2g daily. Repeat bloods after 3/12. Try to eliminate refined carbohydrates, exercise more frequently, increase fibre in your diet and lose some abdominal weight.
Comment Key: VitalsRecommendation
Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA 2.1
BMI and waist circumference raised
