Overview Notes: Your shoulder injury is preventing you from doing the sport you want to do. You are taking more NSAIDS than before and are tender on movement. You also have the palmer fasciitis of your hands. Referral to an Orthopaedic Surgeon that specialise in upper limbs are recommended.
Comment Key: VitaminsOrSupplements
Comment Value: Multivitamin , Omega 3
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA 2.1
BMI and waist circumference raised
------------------------------
Employee: Phillip Spangenberg
Report Date: 2022-01-11
Doctor: Carla Marais
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are following up with a Urologist (2 yearly). You mentioned still experiencing a few symptoms at night - hopefully with some habit adjustments (avoid fluids before bedtime) & continuing Betmiga this will improve. You report a functional manageable baseline.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Cholesterol: Reinitiate Crestor 5mg. Remember alcohol&diet play a significant role in your cardiovascular health. Take omega 3 supplements 2g daily. Repeat bloods after 3/12. Try to eliminate refined carbohydrates, exercise more frequently, increase fibre in your diet and lose some abdominal weight.
Comment Key: VitaminsOrSupplements
Comment Value: Multivitamin , Omega 3
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA 2.1
BMI and waist circumference raised

Clinical Recommendations: There were no current concerns on your examination. Regular screening of any skin lesions is recommended - ‘Mole Mapping’ can be done with a Dermatologist. If any changes in size/ shape/ colour of a skin mark - to seek medical review.
Men's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are following up with a Urologist (2 yearly). You mentioned still experiencing a few symptoms at night - hopefully with some habit adjustments (avoid fluids before bedtime) & continuing Betmiga this will improve. You report a functional manageable baseline.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: On your left palm you have an irregular mole that is increasing in size - please get it reviewed by a Dermatologist.
Comment Key: VitaminsOrSupplements
Comment Value: Multivitamin , Omega 3
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA 2.1
BMI and waist circumference raised
------------------------------
Employee: Phillip Spangenberg
Report Date: 2022-01-11
Doctor: Carla Marais
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are following up with a Urologist (2 yearly). You mentioned still experiencing a few symptoms at night - hopefully with some habit adjustments (avoid fluids before bedtime) & continuing Betmiga this will improve. You report a functional manageable baseline.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Your shoulder injury is preventing you from doing the sport you want to do. You are taking more NSAIDS than before and are tender on movement. You also have the palmer fasciitis of your hands. Referral to an Orthopaedic Surgeon that specialise in upper limbs are recommended.

Employee: Phillip Spangenberg
Report Date: 2022-01-11
Doctor: Carla Marais
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: Try meds I've given you and let me know if all is good. Please see Urologist regularly for check ups.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Cholesterol: Reinitiate Crestor 5mg. Remember alcohol&diet play a significant role in your cardiovascular health. Take omega 3 supplements 2g daily. Repeat bloods after 3/12. Try to eliminate refined carbohydrates, exercise more frequently, increase fibre in your diet and lose some abdominal weight.

------------------------------
Employee: Phillip Spangenberg
Report Date: 2022-01-11
Doctor: Carla Marais
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: There were no current concerns on your examination. Regular screening of any skin lesions is recommended - ‘Mole Mapping’ can be done with a Dermatologist. If any changes in size/ shape/ colour of a skin mark - to seek medical review.
Men's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are following up with a Urologist (2 yearly). You mentioned still experiencing a few symptoms at night - hopefully with some habit adjustments (avoid fluids before bedtime) & continuing Betmiga this will improve. You report a functional manageable baseline.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: No alcohol use
No smoking

Employee: Phillip Spangenberg
Report Date: 2022-01-11
Doctor: Carla Marais
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: Try meds I've given you and let me know if all is good. Please see Urologist regularly for check ups.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Cholesterol: Reinitiate Crestor 5mg. Remember alcohol&diet play a significant role in your cardiovascular health. Take omega 3 supplements 2g daily. Repeat bloods after 3/12. Try to eliminate refined carbohydrates, exercise more frequently, increase fibre in your diet and lose some abdominal weight.

------------------------------

Report Date: 2022-01-11
Doctor: Carla Marais
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: 
Men's Health Recommendations: Try meds I've given you and let me know if all is good. Please see Urologist regularly for check ups.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Your shoulder injury is preventing you from doing the sport you want to do. You are taking more NSAIDS than before and are tender on movement. You also have the palmer fasciitis of your hands. Referral to an Orthopaedic Surgeon that specialise in upper limbs are recommended.

Employee: Phillip Spangenberg
Report Date: 2022-01-11
Doctor: Carla Marais
Nurse: Lebo Cindi
Clinical Recommendations: There were no current concerns on your examination. Regular screening of any skin lesions is recommended - ‘Mole Mapping’ can be done with a Dermatologist. If any changes in size/ shape/ colour of a skin mark - to seek medical review.
Men's Health Recommendations: I am glad to hear that you are following up with a Urologist (2 yearly). You mentioned still experiencing a few symptoms at night - hopefully with some habit adjustments (avoid fluids before bedtime) & continuing Betmiga this will improve. You report a functional manageable baseline.
Women's Health Recommendations: 
Overview Notes: Cholesterol: Reinitiate Crestor 5mg. Remember alcohol&diet play a significant role in your cardiovascular health. Take omega 3 supplements 2g daily. Repeat bloods after 3/12. Try to eliminate refined carbohydrates, exercise more frequently, increase fibre in your diet and lose some abdominal weight.
Comment Key: WomensHealthRecommendation
Comment Value: None

Comment Value: None
Special Investigation Notes: DHEA 2.1
BMI and waist circumference raised
